result.execSummary:
All charges against Anthony Lamar Fields in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Lamar Fields is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:28 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Defendant Anthony Lamar Fields in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Anthony Lamar Fields.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Harrelson argues bond modification and requests lower cash bond, as DE has posted $500 already. Atty Harrelson is currently compiling alibi and intends to file once completed. ADA Rockow objects to modification, as DE has had a number of missed appearances according to NCIC records, and may be a flight risk. Court denies modification at this time but will reconsider if verification that DE is able to stay at River Falls residence and if owner of residence is willing to co-sign bond. DE clarifies address. Atty Harrelson to contact JA to set further BBH. Adjourned at 1:38 PM.  gll

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device 500 FT restriction from 1704 Fairway Drive Hudson, WI 54016. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Dominique. M or residence 1704 Fairway Drive Hudson, WI 54016. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

3:04 PM  Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Yates.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Anthony Lamar Fields.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anthony Lamar Fields in court, in custody. 
S/T Hudson PD Officer L. Radke. Atty Ballo direct. DE identified in courtroom. State's Exhibit #1 O/R. Atty Harrelson cross. Atty re-direct. Officer Radke dismissed. Atty arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Harrelson requests arraignment; Atty Ballo no objection. Court grants Arraignment request; Waiver of reading, NG to all counts, speedy trial reserved. Atty Harrelson requests bond modification. Atty Ballo argument. Court modifies bond is modified to $1000 cash. All other bond stipulations remain. Adjourned: 3:44 p.m.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:31 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court. Defendant Anthony Lamar Fields in court, in custody. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Unknown who will be assigned this case. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Reserve on pre-plea rights. Court sets PH with court commissioner. Adjourned 01:42 PM
